servinfo.title: Immobilizer Control System Introduction
servinfo.ptxt: The immobilizer control system is an anti-theft device that immobilizes the vehicle. It stops the engine from working and prevents the vehicle from being stolen. It mainly consists of the following components.

item.ptxt: Immobilizer control module (ICM) with the built-in coil antenna
Ignition key with the built-in transponder

servinfo.ptxt: A code called the transponder code is memorized in the transponder. And, the code is registered with ECM. Basically, when the ignition switch is turned ON, ECM reads the code by the coil antenna. When that code agrees with the ICM registered code, ICM compares the secret code with ECM. When their secret codes agree, the engine can be started.If there is no agreement between transponder codes of ICM and ignition key or between secret codes of ICM and ECM, ECM stops fuel injection to prevent the engine from starting and turn the injection warning light ON and OFF using CAN communication line.
